Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which products in the Donald J. Trump Collection are not made in the U.S.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that some companies, such as Brooks Brothers, do make apparel in the U.S.
Understate: The claim understates the percentage of clothing and shoes sold in the U.S. that are made overseas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that products in the Donald J. Trump Collection are not made in the U.S.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that because most clothing sold in the U.S. is made overseas, all products in the Donald J. Trump Collection must also be made overseas.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that some companies within the American Apparel & Footwear Association do make clothes and shoes in the United States.
